title: Tracking Thermal Metamorphism of Organic Matter and Iron Minerals in the Primitive Meteorite Orgueil with Transmission X-ray and Electron Microscopy
content: Carbonaceous chondrite meteorites are samples from asteroids that initially accreted in colder regions of the early solar nebula, where ice and organic matter accumulated on dust grains. Primitive examples of these materials (e.g., those that appear to have the least amount of aqueous alteration or thermal metamorphism on the asteroid) serve as an important record of the early history of organic matter and other mineral components of the solar nebula. Untangling the effects of aqueous and thermal alteration is difficult because these meteorites contain many different crystalline and amorphous components, many of which have grain sizes < 100 nm.
